  • Constructor Details

    • ClientGUI

      public ClientGUI​(java.lang.String ip, int port)
      This is the intermediary between Server and the Client. Here we receive input from Server, converting it in order to show to the User's GUI

      Here are implemented methods to write and read from Socket

      It works like the normal Client for CLI, but also need to convert from String to relative element in GUI. This is made in SantoriniGUI, here we only set the CurrentStateOfGUI

      Parameters:
      ip - Ip of the Server we want to connect to
      port - Port on which the Client and Server will speak
      See Also:
      Server

  • Method Details

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Returns:
      true if active, false otherwise

    • setActive

      public void setActive​(boolean active)
      Parameters:
      active - true to set active, false otherwise

    • decoderGUI

      private void decoderGUI​(java.lang.String s)
      Check input sent to CLI, and decode it setting the StateOfGUI; Then send an Update to SantoriniGUI
      Parameters:
      s - String received from the CLI

    • asyncReadFromSocket

      public java.lang.Thread asyncReadFromSocket​(java.io.ObjectInputStream socketIn)
      A dedicated thread created to receive Objects from the Server

      Call the decoderGUI(String) if socketIn is a String

      Call the santoriniGUI update method, to show changes in Board

      If an execption occur this thread will be killed

      Parameters:
      socketIn - An ObjectInputStream to receive from the Socket
      Returns:
      New thread waiting for input from the Server

    • asyncWriteToSocket

      public java.lang.Thread asyncWriteToSocket​(java.io.PrintWriter socketOut)
      A dedicated thread created to receive the converted input from the GUI( a String). This is added to a queque, and then flush when queque is not empty

      If an execption occur this thread will be killed

      Parameters:
      socketOut - a PrintWriter, where the output received from the GUI will be send
      Returns:
      New thread waiting for input from the GUI

    • run

      public void run() throws java.io.IOException
      The main thread associated to the ClientGUI
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Should be never used, since Threads that read or write to Socket are killed if an exception occurs
      See Also:
      asyncReadFromSocket(ObjectInputStream), asyncWriteToSocket(PrintWriter)
